title: Falling U.S. Hospitalizations, Infections Bolster Hope Omicron Wave Is Waning
sub_head: Data reinforces the experience of previous countries that Omicron is less dangerous to an infected individual
body:
Covid-19 case counts and hospitalizations in the U.S. continued to decline, according to the latest data, bolstering hopes that the Omicron wave of the pandemic has peaked even as deaths of people with the disease reached the highest levels at the weekend in almost a year.
The seven-day average of people in U.S. hospitals with Covid-19 fell below 144,000 on Sunday for the first time in nearly three weeks. The number has been falling now for about 10 days, according to data from the Department of Health and Human Services.
